title: Hong Kong Court Sentences Pro-Democracy Figure To 20 years In Prison | 10 News
description: A Hong Kong court has sentenced former media tycoon Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison. title: Violent Clashes Break Out Between Police And Protesters At Anti-Herzog Protest In Sydney | 10 News
description: Protesters who gathered at Sydney Town Hall last night to speak out against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's Australian visit were pepper-sprayed, arrested, punched and shoved by police.  Videos posted online show violent scenes between officers and protesters as police cracked down on those trying to move beyond a designated zone during the demonstrations.  NSW Premier Chris Minns has defended police actions, insisting police had been placed in an "impossible situation last night".  NSW police said 27 people were arrested and 10 officers were assaulted though none of those assaults were serious. title: Daylight Armoured Truck Heist In Italy | 10 News
description: An armoured truck heist, which included a shoot-out and explosion, has shut down an Italian highway.  Local reports state that bandits stopped an armoured truck on the 613 Brindisi-Lecce Superstrada in Italy's Puglia region, before a large explosion blasted the side of the van open.  There are conflicting reports as to whether the bandits escaped with much of a haul, however a gunfight ensued with the Carabinieri (Italian military police).  Police arrested two suspects with several believed to still be on the run. title: Savannah Guthrie Issues Plea For Public's Help To Find Mother, Nancy | 10 News
description: US television host Savannah Guthrie has issued another emotional plea, appealing for help from members of the public, nine days after her mother Nancy was allegedly abducted in Arizona.  Guthrie said in a video posted to Instagram that the family believes Nancy is “still out there” and asked viewers to report anything “strange” to law enforcement.  “We are at an hour of desperation and we need your help,” Savannah said. title: DFAT Apologises To Families Of Laos Methanol Poisoning Victims | 10 News
description: The Department of Foreign Affairs has apologised to the families of two young women who died after drinking methanol laced drinks in Laos, saying it failed in its commitment to consular service.  Staff members at the backpacker hostel that served the drinks have received a nominal fine, leaving the parents of the two Australian women fearing they’ll never get justice.  Abby Dinham has more. title: Buckingham Palace Says King Charles Will Support Police In Andrew-Epstein Probe | 10 News
description: Buckingham Palace has issued a bombshell statement confirming King Charles will support police as they consider investigations into his brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.  It comes as the Prince and Princess of Wales make their first public statement following the release of more troubling documents linking the former Prince Andrew to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
